Package org.myrobotlab.robotarm

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Coord3D  
    Joint
    Adapted class from http://fivedots.coe.psu.ac.th/~ad/jg/nui06/index.html Joint.java Andrew Davison, ad@fivedots.coe.psu.ac.th, June 2011 Class for rotating a joint in the robot arm Each joint instance maintains state information about its joint: its current rotation angle (currAngle); its rotation rate (rotRate), so a rotation angle can be translated into a rotation time; rotation limits (posLimit, negLimit) beyond which a rotation is impossible The state information is read from (and written to) a file called JI.txt, which has the form: rotate: limits: angle: The loaded rotation time is converted into a rotation rate.
    RobotArm
    Adapted from http://fivedots.coe.psu.ac.th/~ad/jg/nui06/index.html RobotArm.java Andrew Davison, ad@fivedots.coe.psu.ac.th, June 2011 Class for rotating the Maplin Robot Arm (http://www.maplin.co.uk/robotic-arm-kit-with-usb-pc-interface-266257) It appears to be the UK version of the US OWI-535 (http://www.imagesco.com/robotics/owi-535.html) The inverse kinematics code in calcIK() comes from http://www.circuitsathome.com/mcu/robotic-arm-inverse-kinematics-on-arduino
  • Enum Summary

    JointID
